intro: Triumfetta multipliciforma, commonly known as the many-leafed triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and broad, lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, and it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Triumfetta multipliciforma is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber in some regions.
